top_categories.workout_context: At 93 miles, Gravel One Fifty punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Gravel One Fifty rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Gravel One Fifty’s dutch countryside, flat gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Gravel One Fifty isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel One Fifty. Make this intensity feel like home.
Gravel One Fifty’s dutch flat gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel One Fifty when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Every session at Gravel One Fifty intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel One Fifty — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Gravel One Fifty — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
High-volume endurance builds the aerobic base that makes Gravel One Fifty’s race-day efforts sustainable rather than destructive.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Gravel One Fifty’s dutch flat gravel delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel One Fifty’s 93 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel One Fifty requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on dutch flat gravel to build confidence. Expect: dutch countryside, flat gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 93 miles of dutch flat gravel in Roden, Drenthe, Netherlands.
